bTU6KwGwjMfD1nn5MlU6lg.text: The service was a little slow in the beginning, which was strange as we were the only table in the restaurant.  However, once we managed to order, everything arrived reasonably quickly and the waitress was very friendly. We ordered prawn katsu udon (very delicious), chicken katsu udon and salmon bento for main. Also, the 16 pieces sashimi selection.  Everyone was very happy with their food choice and it was very good value as the portions were very reasonable. Even better with 10% off for checking in on Yelp.  Will definitely come back and become a regular.

2r8MAmEBk1CEUaffJskzXg.text: Great little sushi place with a variety of options other than sushi.  The food was delicious and the portions were above average.  Highly recommend the Auvergne starter.

LU2iyHkITRIF1sy3b71QRw.text: Kanji was absolutely splendid. Great atmosphere with cool seating. Came here with 7 best friends and we were very impressed with the waitstaff. Will definitely return next time in edinburgh.

39f6l-Zj6f--wOFiTyxX9g.text: Fantastic sushi and service! Will definitely be back! I definitely recommend making a reservation. We went on a Sunday night and it was almost full. My mom enjoyed a bento box and I ordered a red dragon roll and spider crab & avocado hand roll. We shared a bottle of sake as well. Very good food, great service and we'll be back again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Spider crab and avocado hand roll
Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Red Dragon roll

RdDbUBcQi9R0yZlEeUwhCQ.text: I love Kenji sushi. Now been three times and even booked it to celebrate my birthday earlier this month.  Great quality food but not expensive at all. We had a great meal (6 of us) and our bill was just over 20 each for a ridiculous amount of food, including sushi sets. The fish is always super tasty and fresh and everything I've had is fab.  Lovely, casual vibe and drinks are reasonably priced with bottles of wine around 14.  Quite a large menu of starters, tempura, rice, noodle dishes, sashimi, nigri and various sushi sets. The sushi sets are fab value and commonly around 10 for beautifully presented food. Vegetarian friends are well catered for here as there are loads of options.  Staff are great at accommodating gluten free and even provide gluten free soy sauce which is a nice touch so you are not left out.  This is my too choice for sushi - food is always spot on, great service and I love the casual dining experience without it all being a bit Yo sushi! Five stars from me :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Kenji Sushi selection
Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gluten free soy sauce available
Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu

uLEEPD8R1_cq9DCnqXJYsw.text: So here goes guys- a new sushi joint in Stockbridge! And let me say, I am completely and utterly delighted!  Firstly, if you're going for lunch they may not be open at 12pm as stated on this page. I know this because I went for lunch today at 12.30pm and they were closed- so might be worth checking first.   I returned for dinner because, c'mon, it's sushi! And it's all shiny and new!  I booked via yelp (yay!!) for tonight. Service was fantastic, I cannot fault the friendly and helpful servers who were the perfect balance of not overly involved and involved enough that we were never left waiting too long.   After going through the menu which extends beyond sushi to Japanese curries and noodles dishes, we just ordered a whole bunch of stuff for the table to pick at.   The vegetable tempura was and absolute delight. Quite a hefty serving too that was so light and delicate, just a pleasure to eat. We also shared a classic sushi plate, octopus sashimi, dragon roll, gyoza, chicken yakitori and eel nigiri. To keep it short- everything was delicious.   I highly recommend the volcano roll and salmon sashimi which was really fresh and flavourful. Oh and the chicken yakitori- holy toledos was it scrumptious. Even with a full belly I still managed to scoff a skewer down.   There are a range of Japanese spirits available and a choice of two wines (red).   Costing is extremely reasonable too. I mean, we fed three people with six drinks and the bill came to 66. Not the cheapest meal you'll find but for decent quality sushi and Japanese it's what I'd expect to pay.   Whilst not the best sushi I've ever eaten in my life, but this was an incredibly enjoyable meal. It's a small venue and I would reccomend booking in advance. I anticipate as these guys find their feet in this area this will be a highly sought after dinner location in no time!

photos.caption: Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Octopus sashimi
Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Classic sushi platter
Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

LWrZ1hFCiKVP60uc_pisiw.text: Very nice joint!  Beautiful decor!  Peaceful...Out of Scotland as soon as you set foot, which is desirable sometimes when you've had enough of real life, no fault of Scotland...  like stepping into Asia of days bygone, zen... Not part of the meaning crowd.   A delight in Stockbridge which is as Edinburgh as you can get!    I had the Nigiri set which is 7 piece sushi of all kinds fishes! Plus 2 pieces sweet cakes made of egg pudding and 2 pieces of rice wrapped in sweet skin made of soy protein. Large sake -- two small bottles with 50% discount because you know your limit before you ordered!  I love sake and can drink a large bottle, no problem!    Great staff!  Good service!

photos.caption: Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Nice decor!
Photo of Kenji Sushi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Nigiri Set! Pretty good.  Seafood is awesome in Scotland so they have that fact on their side!

6BVykkFT59dbZ9tUF4PdLA.text: Wonderful Sushi and a great date night spot in Stockbridge. We just moved into the neighborhood and will definitely be returning soon.  One thing to note, they only take cash.

JAsYVCZ5AYtj0G0uuP-MGw.text: Fantastic  Wonderful staff  Great food  everyone in our group of 6 had a excellent meal  Prices are very reasonable  We will be back soon  Another groovy addition to St Stephen Street

W7dNHm9K7eouXHEheFJ1wg.text: So glad that this place has opened on my street. I've ate from there three times now and it's been very good every time.   Really good sushi, delicious fried dishes and excellent udon noodles.  The decor and service is also very pleasant with a sort of japanese seating area to the rear of the restaurant.  Its my new go-to local restaurant for asian food!

v6gGXLzgzQ-HFXd710o3tQ.text: Really impressed.  This is a small place, with thoughtful decor, lovely staff and the food is really, really, exceptional.  Not just a great addition to Stockbridge but for Edinburgh.  The only issue right now is that they do not take credit cards which is a draw back that hopefully will be fixed as they are new.  Delighted to have found it :-)
